shortAbout: (Pyotr Ustinovich Brovka. Belarusian public figure, writer, poet and translator. Member of the Union of Writers of the USSR since 1934. Academician of the Academy of Sciences of the BSSR (1966, corresponding member since 1953)

biography.info: He was born in a poor peasant family, where his father, Ustin Adamovich, made chests and cupboards, and his mother, Elena Stepanovna, was a housewife, took care of children.

At first Pyotr Brovka became a house education. In Lepel he graduated from a parochial school and studied at the Lepel Higher Primary School, but his family did't have enough money for a full completed education.
He worked as a copyist, a document controller and a bookkeeper.
He was head of the department of the Young Communist League district committee in Polotsk.
He was the executive secretary of the newspaper.
He enrolled in the Literature-Linguistics Department of Belarusian State University, graduating in 1931.
In the family was born a son Yura.
He served in the Workers' Peasant Red Army and worked in the front and partisan press.
He was the executive secretary of the Writers' Union of the BSSR.
The chief editor of the literary magazine “Polymya”.
Brovka was elected chairman of the Writers' Union of the Byelorussian SSR.
The chief editor of the Byelorussian Soviet Encyclopedia.
